title: Cape Hatteras National Seashore: Be A Junior Ranger
body: Be A Junior Ranger         Ranger and kid exploring the biota of Pamlico Sound National Park Service  The Junior Ranger Program is a fun way to learn more about our park and how you can help protect it - just like our park rangers! The Junior Ranger Program at the seashore is designed for kids ages 5 to 13. This is an in-park program and must be completed while you are at the park--we do not mail out booklets or badges. To become an official Cape Hatteras National Seashore Junior Ranger during the summer program season (mid-June to Labor Day), you will need to:  Attend two ranger programs - there is a program schedule in In The Park, the park newspaper, which you can get at any of our visitor centers  and/or  Complete the Junior Ranger booklet (available at any of our visitor centers) appropriate for your age.  If you complete the booklet, you will earn a Junior Ranger badge.  If you are visiting the park during any other time period, you can earn a Junior Ranger badge by completing the booklet. If you are not able to visit the park, you can still become a National Park Service Junior Ranger on-line and learn about the jobs of park rangers by visiting www.nps.gov/webrangers. Complete all the activities and you can become a Web Ranger!
